question_text: Butanone is a four-carbon compound with the functional group:
answer_explanation_text: It contains a ketonic group. Ketones have suffix - one. Butane + one = Butanone

question_text: An organic compound X with molecular formula C2H4O2 turns blue litmus red and gives brisk effervescence with sodium bicarbonate. Identify the compound?
answer_explanation_text:
C2H4O2 must be CH3COOH since it turns blue litmus red and gives brisk effervescence with NaHCO3 due to the evolution of CO2.
CH3COOH + NaHCO3 --> CH3COONa + H2O + CO2

question_text: Chlorine reacts with saturated hydrocarbons at room temperature in the:
answer_explanation_text:
Chlorine reacts rapidly with saturated hydrocarbons in the presence of sunlight.
One such reaction is, CH4 + Cl2 --> CH3Cl + HCl (in the presence of sunlight). This reaction is also called chlorination reaction.

question_text: The number of C-H bonds in ethane (C2H6) molecule are:
answer_explanation_text: There are six C-H bonds and one C-C bond. So, Total 6 convalent bond between C- H

question_text: Which of the following organic compounds does not have the same chemical properties as methanol?
answer_explanation_text: Methanol is alcohol having general formula CnH2n+1O. C2H6O, C4H10O, and C7H16O belong to the same series except C5H10O. Thus, C5H10O does not have the same chemical properties as methanol.

question_text: Oils on treating with hydrogen in the presence of palladium or nickel catalyst form fats. This is an example of:
answer_explanation_text: Oils on treating with hydrogen in the presence of palladium or nickel catalyst form fats. This is an example of addition reaction because hydrogen is added to oil from reducing agents palladium or nickel.

question_text: Buckminsterfullerene is an allotropic form of:
answer_explanation_text: Buckminsterfullerene is an allotropic form of carbon. It resembles the geodesic dome designed by Buckminster.

question_text: Ethanol, on heating at 443 K with conc H2S04 gives
answer_explanation_text:
When ethanol is heated with concentrated sulphuric acid at 443 K, dehydration takes place and ethene is formed. In this reaction concentrated sulphuric acid acts as a dehydrating agent.
CH3-CH2-OH --> (H2SO4 + heat) --> CH2=CH2 + H2O

question_text: The blindness and death is caused by consuming adulterated liquor contains.
answer_explanation_text: Methanol causes blindness and even death. It is also known as denatured alcohol.

question_text: The first member of alkyne homologous series is
answer_explanation_text: The smallest alkyne contains two carbon atoms with a triple bond between them.

question_text: The alcoholic drinks contain
answer_explanation_text: CH3CH2OH is present in alcoholic drinks. It is known as ethanol which is prepared by fermentation of sugar (molasses).

question_text: Ethanol reacts with Na metal to form
answer_explanation_text: C2H5OH + 2Na --> C2H5ONa + H2

question_text: Which of the following does not belong to the same homologous series?
answer_explanation_text: Compounds (a), (b) and (c) are saturated hydrocarbons but compound (d) is unsaturated. Compounds of the same homologous series have the same general formula.

question_text:
The heteroatoms present in CH3-CH2-O-CH2-CH2Cl are
(i) oxygen
(ii) carbon
(iii) hydrogen
(iv) chlorine
answer_explanation_text: The atoms other than hydrogen and carbon are called heteroatoms.

question_text: Carbon forms four covalent bonds by sharing its four valence electrons with four univalent atoms, e.g., hydrogen. After the formation of four bonds, carbon attains the electronic configuration of
answer_explanation_text:
After sharing four electrons with four univalent atoms, carbon has 6 + 4 = 10 electrons.
Neon also contains 10 electrons.

question_text: Vinegar is a solution of
answer_explanation_text: Vinegar is a diluted solution of acetic acid in water. It's composition is 5% - 8% of acetic acid in water.

question_text: The name of the compound CH3-CH2-CHO is
answer_explanation_text: It contains a total of three carbon atoms with an aldehyde group. Propane + al = propanal.

question_text: Ethanol reacts with sodium and forms two products. These are
answer_explanation_text:
The equation for the reaction between sodium and ethanol can be written as:
2CH3CH2OH + 2Na --> 2CH3CH2ONa + H2
Therefore, the products formed are sodium ethoxide and hydrogen.

question_text:
Mineral acids are stronger acids than carboxylic acids because:
(i) mineral acids are completely ionised.
(ii) carboxylic acids are completely ionised.
(iii) mineral acids are partially ionised.
(iv) carboxylic acids are partially ionised.
answer_explanation_text: It is well known that mineral acids are completely ionised while carboxylic acids are partially ionised.

question_text: Most carbon compounds
option_1_text: are poor conductors of electricity and have high boiling points
option_2_text: are good conductors of electricity and have high boiling points
option_3_text: are poor conductors of electricity and have low boiling points
option_4_text: are good conductors of electricity and have low boiling points
answer_explanation_text: Organic compounds have covalent bonding in their molecules. Such compounds are poor conductors of electricity and have low boiling points.

question_text: Chlorine reacts with saturated hydrocarbons at room temperature in the
answer_explanation_text:
Answer B. Chlorine reacts with saturated hydrocarbons at room temperature in the presence of sunlight.
Chlorine is a highly reactive element that readily reacts with unsaturated hydrocarbons, such as alkenes and alkynes, to form addition products.
However, when it comes to saturated hydrocarbons, chlorine can only react in the presence of sunlight.
The presence of sunlight is essential for this reaction to occur because it provides the necessary energy to break the chlorine molecule into highly reactive chlorine radicals.
These chlorine radicals then react with the saturated hydrocarbon, breaking one or more carbon-hydrogen bonds and replacing the hydrogen atoms with chlorine atoms.
This reaction is known as photochemical chlorination.
